titleStmt.title: J. M. Atkeson et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10727

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin Govenor of the State of Kentucky your humble petitioner ^T. L. Prater^ would respectfully State that Some time in may he was fined by A. M. Adams ^$7.87^ a Justice of the Peace for Magoffin County Kentucky for profane Swearing & contempt of court So says the charges your Petitioner would State your petitioner would state that he believes the charge to be unjust. Samuel Salyers & Stephen Howard States the same both being present at the time the said Prater should have committed the said offence. He refuses to pay said fine believing it as aforesaid to be unjust and humbly begs your excellency to remit the same promising never to be guilty of an offence as charged against him $5.90

J. M. Atkeson
James Wood
andrew J Patter
John Samuels
Jeff. Ward
Benjamin Hammon
James. F. Bailey
Benjamin howard Sen
Wm Hignite
Thomas Brooks
Able Caudill
Ribin Patrick
John Prater
John W Patrick
D. M. Atkeson
David D. Sublett
Abner Salyer
William R Salyer
Steven howard
David Salyer
John Salsers
Benjamine howard
Lewis howard Esquire
Isiah Salyer
David Salyer
BenJamine Pucket
Daniel gullet
William Blanten
William P Prater
Wm S. Adams
